data: The museum is housed in a 16th century monastery, and is arranged across rooms. The first room looks at sites from around the area (Terravecchia and Monte Riparato). The second room has later material from the site of Caltavuturo vecchio. The third room is dedicated to Monte Riparato (small finds, mosaic, Greek inscription) some 7th century BC, but mainly 4th and 3rd, and some Samian ware. The final room is given over to the numismatic collection, the focal point of which is a Republican coin hoard found in the area
Museo Civico "Don G. Guarneri", Piazza San Francesco n�1, Caltavuturo, 90022 PA
Inscription recording an architect called Proxenos

Four lines of Greek letters filling the surviving face, with a regular left
                                        margin, uneven right margin

Deep, square cut, regular letters showing features of both middle and later
                                    Hellenistic texts: alpha with broken bar; mu and sigma with parallel bars; pi with
                                    equal vertical strokes; omega closed as circle on the horizontal bar in line 3,
                                    above the bar in line 1; episoli and xsi with short middle bar; omicron smaller and
                                    above the line.
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo 2017-09-05
Brugnone, 2016, Iscrizione greca dall’abitato ellenistico sul Monte Riparato (Caltavuturo, Palermo)
inscription recording an architect called proxenos
